info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 8:41AM CDT until May 3 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County.
Illinois River at Chewey affecting Cherokee, Adair and Delaware Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Illinois River near Tahlequah.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, no flooding occurs but all recreational floating along the Illinois River ceases at and above 9.5 feet.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.4 feet early Thursday afternoon. This forecast only includes the next 24 hours of forecast rainfall. Additional rainfall is expected beyond 24 hours. Interests along the river should continue to monitor updates to this forecast and remain alert for a possible upgrade to a flood warning. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
